    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void reject(ValidationLevel errorLevel, java.lang.String strErrorReason, ValidationLevel warningLevel, java.lang.String strWarningReason)
      Rejects the root bean w/ a global message

      Note the reason why the bean failed validation shouldn't refer to a particular field in the entity. To do that, use the rejectField() method.

      Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

      void rejectField(java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath, ValidationLevel errorLevel, java.lang.String strErrorReason, ValidationLevel warningLevel, java.lang.String strWarningReason)
      Rejects a particular field or field path on the root bean.

      Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

      void rejectFieldWithFlowStep(java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath, ValidationLevel errorLevel, java.lang.String strErrorReason, ValidationLevel warningLevel, java.lang.String strWarningReason, java.lang.String flowStepId)
      Rejects a particular field or field path on the root bean.

      Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

      void rejectSubField(KeyableBean relatedBean, java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath, ValidationLevel errorLevel, java.lang.String strErrorReason, ValidationLevel warningLevel, java.lang.String strWarningReason)
      Reject a particular field of field path on a bean related to the root bean, e.g. an array element of the bean such as an Exposure of a Claim.

      Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

      void rejectSubFieldWithFlowStep(KeyableBean relatedBean, java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath, ValidationLevel errorLevel, java.lang.String strErrorReason, ValidationLevel warningLevel, java.lang.String strWarningReason, java.lang.String flowStepId)
      Reject a particular field of field path on a bean related to the root bean, e.g. an array element of the bean such as an Exposure of a Claim.

      Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

      Note that this is the fullest version of "reject"; all the others are overloaded for easier use.
      void rejectWithFlowStep(ValidationLevel errorLevel, java.lang.String strErrorReason, ValidationLevel warningLevel, java.lang.String strWarningReason, java.lang.String flowStepId)
      Rejects the root bean w/ a global message

      Note the reason why the bean failed validation shouldn't refer to a particular field in the entity. To do that, use the rejectField() method.

      Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

    • Method Detail

      • reject

        void reject(ValidationLevel errorLevel,
          java.lang.String strErrorReason,
          ValidationLevel warningLevel,
          java.lang.String strWarningReason)
        Rejects the root bean w/ a global message

        Note the reason why the bean failed validation shouldn't refer to a particular field in the entity. To do that, use the rejectField() method.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Parameters:
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.

      • rejectField

        void rejectField(java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath,
               ValidationLevel errorLevel,
               java.lang.String strErrorReason,
               ValidationLevel warningLevel,
               java.lang.String strWarningReason)
        Rejects a particular field or field path on the root bean.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Parameters:
        strRelativeFieldPath - The relative path from the root bean to the field that failed validation.
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.

      • rejectWithFlowStep

        void rejectWithFlowStep(ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                      java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                      ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                      java.lang.String strWarningReason,
                      java.lang.String flowStepId)
        Rejects the root bean w/ a global message

        Note the reason why the bean failed validation shouldn't refer to a particular field in the entity. To do that, use the rejectField() method.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Parameters:
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.
        flowStepId - The process FlowStep that this error applies to, if any

      • rejectFieldWithFlowStep

        void rejectFieldWithFlowStep(java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath,
                           ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                           java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                           ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                           java.lang.String strWarningReason,
                           java.lang.String flowStepId)
        Rejects a particular field or field path on the root bean.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Parameters:
        strRelativeFieldPath - The relative path from the root bean to the field that failed validation.
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.
        flowStepId - The process FlowStep that this error applies to, if any

      • rejectSubField

        void rejectSubField(KeyableBean relatedBean,
                  java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath,
                  ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                  java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                  ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                  java.lang.String strWarningReason)
        Reject a particular field of field path on a bean related to the root bean, e.g. an array element of the bean such as an Exposure of a Claim.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Parameters:
        relatedBean - Bean related to the root bean
        strRelativeFieldPath - The relative path from the root bean to the field that failed validation.
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.

      • rejectSubFieldWithFlowStep

        void rejectSubFieldWithFlowStep(KeyableBean relatedBean,
                              java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath,
                              ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                              java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                              ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                              java.lang.String strWarningReason,
                              java.lang.String flowStepId)
        Reject a particular field of field path on a bean related to the root bean, e.g. an array element of the bean such as an Exposure of a Claim.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Note that this is the fullest version of "reject"; all the others are overloaded for easier use.

        Parameters:
        relatedBean - Bean related to the root bean
        strRelativeFieldPath - The relative path from the root bean to the field that failed validation.
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.
        flowStepId - The process FlowStep that this error applies to, if any
